name: Iberostar Rose Hall Suites

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My girlfriend and I were looking for a place to getaway for 5 days in the cold December month. We considered a lot of “couple” place but choose to go here based on the great reviews we found all around.
reviews.title: A great place to stay all around

reviews.text: The place was great, the amenities and the service of the hotel were amazing. Our room looked out to the water and was definitely worth the little bit extra. But overall the price was great to since we booked it on Orbitz.
reviews.title: Great time, Mon

reviews.text: The weather was not all perfect in December but we got plenty of swimming, sailing, and tanning in.
reviews.title: Absolutely Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only reason I would not give it a five star is because for me personally it did not feel like we were in Jamaica. I have been to a smaller place before and there was a lot more of the Jamaican culture present in the hotel. What I mean is music, food, etc.
reviews.title: One of the Best Vacas

reviews.text: If you want to just get away to warm place and don’t really care for anything else this is the perfect place for you!
reviews.title: Very impressed and good value

reviews.text: This resort is incredible. You read all the reviews before you go and you're a little worried that you chose the wrong resort but let me start by saying that you shouldn't judge until you experience it yourself. This resort exceeded my expectations. The service, the room, the food, the entertainment was exceptional. I have 7 & 5 years old girls who are borderline OCD and they were very comfortable at this resort. From check-in to check-out, I have no complaints. Only one minor one and that's the dampness in the room, but we are by the ocean and its HOT so not a big issue, main thing is that we were on vacation on a beautiful resort. This resort is kid friendly, amazing kids club (my girls did not want to leave) with a mini waterpark. Variety of foods for the kids to eat, always, pizza, fries & pasta. And entertainment for them every night. The a la cart restaurants were deli, especially the Mediterrean, awesome seafood platter. If you like jerk chicken, jerk pork, jerk fish, rice and peas & plantain you have booked the right resort, the food as my husband would say was "exceptional" Because of the time we went it was quite busy but what resort isn't, so you would have to wake up early to save a good spot by the pool. But again we were up early not wasting a minute of sun. The staff were friendly and I felt very safe at this resort. We are definitely coming back same time next year!!!
reviews.title: Amazing vacation & resort

reviews.text: We returned from our second visit to this resort as we enjoyed our first trip in 2011 because of the friendly staff. Overall, this is an excellent resort for families for an all inclusive. We experienced minor issues with the room and service in the restaurant's but the staff will go out of their way to correct the issues.
reviews.title: Second visit with Family

reviews.text: ROOMS
reviews.title: Amazing

reviews.text: We requested a few inquiries prior to arrival which were accommodated except of being on a high floor. When we personally requested it, we were moved to a top floor with a beautiful view of the ocean thanks to Orlando (Front Desk) who made this happen. Initially our TV, AC and keys to the door were not working. The friendly maintenance team simply swapped the TV for a new one and the AC was fixed next day. Orlando personally came to meet us in our room to ensure the key issues were resolved. We were given a fruit platter and champagne for the inconvenience which was greatly appreciated. Also provide turn down service with a few chocolates which was a nice touch.
reviews.title: Beautiful resort, very clean and kid friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: RESTAURANTS
reviews.title: Excellent Resort

reviews.text: Visited as part of a wedding group of approx 25 people. Really liked the location, as it was close to Montego Bay and the airport, and also within good proximity to Ocho Rios to visit activities.
reviews.title: Great Beach Break - Excellent property

reviews.text: Service - generally very good, although the resort didn't appear to manage rush periods very well, like the weekly arrival of a large number of check-ins, or dinner-time rushes for room service orders. Housekeeping and maintenance staff were all very friendly and professional, as were the servers and entertainment staff.
reviews.title: A lovely time had by our family...

reviews.text: Rooms - Rooms are large and well appointed. Service and maintenance requests were attended to reasonably quickly. Nightly turn-down service was appreciated. As several others have noted, the rooms can smell a little musty.
reviews.title: Excellent vacation

reviews.text: Our group all booked Ocean Front rooms, and really enjoyed being able to look out over the ocean. Most of the rooms will pick up some noise from beach parties, which are held either by the resort or as part of wedding packages. The hotel does keep these to a reasonable hour, about 10:30 or 11:00 at night
reviews.title: Great choice for our first All Inclusive vacation.

reviews.text: Food - Large buffets, with plenty of choice, and good selection. Lots of opportunity to try local fruits and foods. Specialty restaurants seem to have only one seating, as there were often many open tables even when we'd been told that the restaurants were fully booked.
reviews.title: Would definitely come back!
Nice but not what you would expect from an "all inclusive" resort..
reviews.text: I just have to say that the resort is beautiful, the rooms are very nice and the lobby is fabulous. My major complaint is that the "all inclusive" is not so all inclusive. All your food and drinks are included, BUT if you want to do any water acitivies like snorkling you can only snorkle off the beach for ONE HOUR a day, if you want to go out on a Kayak you CANNOT snorkle, they have a boat that goes out for $39.00. Now everyone knows what a "banana boat" is, well you would think that would be included also, no it is $20.00 per person. If you take out a sail boat and need instructions they charge you $40.00 and if by chance you need to be brought back by the boat there is a $50.00 charge for the "rescue". I have stayed at all inclusives before, mainly beaches with my family and NEVER had to pay for any of the water activities. If you have small children and they can snorkle bring your own life vest, they charge for those too, $7.00 an hour, they feel if you can swim you do not need one while snorkling. Also the water sports people are not Jamaican and they do not take Jamaican money, only USA dollars. They were very rude when you asked any type of question. We made complaints to the hotel manager but nothing was ever done. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who just enjoys the beach and the pools, if you love to snorkle like I do, do not go to this resort, the area you snorkle at is man made with large boulders, there are fish but nothing like you would see at a reef. Other then the water sports the resort was great, the food was delicious, make your dinner reservations as soon as you get there, the Japanese restaurant books up very fast and is the best one they have. I hope this is helpful in making your decision on this resort. If you go enjoy and have a great time.

We just arrived back from a week at the Iberostar Rose Hall Suites. We were 3 families (6 adults and 4 children – ages 11-15) who traveled for my parents 50th Wedding Anniversary. We had a fabulous time and would highly recommend the hotel.
reviews.title: Relaxing week at a 5 star resort

reviews.text: The hotel is a very manageable size (compared to the Paraiso complex which we have also been to). The grounds are beautiful and very well maintained. The weather in late June was typical from what we are told – sunny, hot and humid in the morning then some light showers in the early afternoon and then sunny again into the later afternoon. We had 2 days with some heavier downpours. There was always a nice breeze down on the beach which got stronger during the late afternoon that cut the heat. They have a large infinity pool, a smaller pool used for pool games and a lazy river (which is quite lazy). The beach is a few steps from the pool with nice sand and many beach chairs and umbrellas. The swimming area does not go out very far so you can stand the whole way. The sea water is very warm (think bathtub). The pool areas and walkways can get slippery after it rains so be careful.
reviews.title: A PERFECT & FABULOUS FAMILY VACATION!! (w/ a 3 yr old & 9 month baby!)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The people at the hotel are always polite, friendly and helpful. Since we were a large group we worked with Loreto online through PR.Suites@iberostar.com.jm before we left. She helped us with dinner reservations and amenities. She was great to work with. Please bring money to tip the employees – they work very hard.
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We also felt very safe throughout the hotel. There are security guards located throughout the hotel and on the beach. We were never harassed while on the Iberostar grounds.
reviews.title: You will love it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As soon as you arrive start it off with a Bob Marley shot...and its on from there!
reviews.title: Best time of our lives....

reviews.text: The food was awesome, go to the Mediterranean Restaurant. The room was clean and the room service was great. Order a dirty banana at the pool bar and look at the ocean. Beautiful beach and friendly staff. The club was crazy for a resort on Friday nights. DIdnt make it to Magaritaville but hear it was good. We will definitely go back.
reviews.title: Would go back again

reviews.text: My wife and I and our kids 3 and 5 yrs old stayed at the Suites from the 11th to the 18th of March. We booked through a travel agency in Montreal and flew with Westjet. The flight was uneventul but I have to say that WestJet seats and tv are small if you compare with AC, then again, the cost was $400 cheaper for the entire family. The transfer from Montego Bay airport to the hotel took about 2.5 hours from the time we got our luggage and the time we got to the hotel. On my next trip I will forego the transfer included in the trip and book a taxi. Once arrived at the hotel, it was exactly as we expected....but even better, the hall is huge and welcoming, check in was swift, welcome non alcoholic included and with a warm Jamaican smile. The room (3318) was great,big with a lot of storage space and we really liked the fact that it was facing west, so no sun in the morning but great sunset in the late afternoon with partial ocean view. We cant think of anything negative about the room except for the bed that was too soft and the pillows too hard, but that's to each his own. We checked out the beach and pools within hours and were very pleased with it, great for swimming, sunbathing and short walks. We did have to go reserve our chairs every morning though as the hotel was fairly busy, otherwise you ended up on the beach chair without any shade which is still not bad. The shows in the evening are a must, thanks to the team of Stars for putting it on day after day, the kids enjoyed it very much and so did we. The food is simply amazing for Buffet style, fresh, full of variaty to please anyone, we took time to thank the Managing Chef as he was on site every day, at all time (forgot his name). .... watch your weight !! I gained 5 lbs on my 200lbs frame !! Room service was superb thanks to Judith and team, since we have young kids that slepts every day, we asked that our room be done in the morning and it was never missed!! dont be shy on the tip, they work very hard for little money.....goes the same for all the serving staff, we spent about $180 in tips in 7 days. For Scuba lovers, this site offers good scuba dive for all levels, good amount of marine life and great staff to take you there. For snorkelers and swimmers, there is enough to do no the beach CAUTION I saw 12 Lion Fish in one hour right on the beach where some rocks are, so dont go swimming around there unlesss you have a mask and snorkel to know what you are swimming in, these fish can pack a punch.
reviews.title: You won't go wrong here - just book it!

reviews.text: Overall this is by far the best vacation we've had so far, best resort, friendly staff...Thank you very much to the managing and working staff for making this stay a blast.
reviews.title: LOVED IT

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I won't repeat the same things said in other reviews. You will love this resort. We have travelled to many in different countries and this is truly a great resort.
reviews.title: Amazing place!

reviews.text: Our stay was over July 4th week with 19 family members First time in Jamaica for us. Absolutely loved everything about this hotel. The room was large and clean. The bed was super comfy. Only complaint was the condensation that builds on the marble floors, can get slippery after showering. Maid service was thorough. Meals were excellent. After trying the restaurants I would probably stick with the buffet, I was always able to find something delicious there. Shout out to Kurt, the omelet man, always smiling! Dion at Aunt Rubys was awesome! The pool/bar was great fun. Tried every drink imaginable. Great bartenders. We enjoyed the activities/contests. Our kids of all ages had a blast. Cannot say enough about the Star Friends. They are crazy fun, Mo-mo, Sweetness, China, Sting Rae, see you again soon, Your the best! Our kids miss them already. The evening entertainment was very good. The older kids enjoyed the disco and karaoke. The beach was so clean, the water was so warm, and there was never a crowd. Strangely the sand stays cool there. The only issue I had was that the property is not very well lit at night if you want to walk around the pool area or go over to Aunt Rubys, and also the hotel balcony lights go out around 11. Prepare to sit on a very dark balcony at night. All in all hope to return soon. Love the people of Jamaica! Irie!
reviews.title: Excellent vacation at Iberostar Rose Hall Suites

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hi there,
reviews.title: Gladys Laure Mc donald

reviews.text: I went to Jamaica with my Boyfriend to this amazing hotel back September 2011. Though it has been a while, i just thought it was only right to give hotel a review.
reviews.title: Ridiculous Rules

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I only have great things to say.
reviews.title: First time in Jamaica, Loved it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was clean, they had great customer service, great entertainment, fantastic staff, beautiful scenery with so many pools and restaurants to eat from, a nice size tv show casing everything.
reviews.title: Amazing Holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was my wife and my first stay at an all-inclusive hotel. We had our reservations about it, but we decided that we just wanted to relax for our honeymoon and forgo the usual exploring we do on trips. After eight days and seven nights we agreed we made the right choice.
reviews.title: Phenomenal Honeymoon

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon our arrival we discovered that our travel agent, or agency (Go-Go Travel), failed to mention to the hotel that this was our honeymoon. Consequently we were booked a room with two double beds. We brought this to the attention of the hotel staff. At first we were told that not much could be done, however, persistence paid off and thanks in great part to Latoya at Guest Services and Jeffery at the front desk we were provided a king size suite with an ocean view. Due to the fact that the mistake was not the hotel’s fault they certainly were not obligated to make it right. But they did; and it made all the difference in the world.
reviews.title: Almost the best trip ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was clean, spacious and comfortable. The staff did a wonderful job maintaining the property. It was spotless. The beach was amazing. It never felt crowded. The staff really made us feel welcome and we did not have to lift a finger. The food was great and options galore. You could do as little or as much as you wanted. We caught one show at night and it blew our expectations out of the water. Think “off-Broadway” not “high-school production” as we had anticipated.
reviews.title: Paradise! This place is WONDERFUL!

reviews.text: A few tips: 1) Make reservations at the restaurants as soon as you arrive. 2) Bring a travel alarm clock; there no clocks (like a casino) 3) Bring a lot of one dollar bills for tips 4) Bring lots of sunscreen 5) Bring a relaxed attitude; Jamaicans like most Caribbean cultures to not adhere to American’s pace of life
reviews.title: Great time with our entire family

reviews.text: We took a “dune-buggy” (really Polaris Rangers) trip booked through JTL Tours (who actually have a desk at the hotel). It was great and from talking to other people it seemed that all the tours they provided were a great experience.
reviews.title: Your average 5star with nothing for teens

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you're looking for a laid-back, relaxing and enjoyable time, spend your vacation here. The suite was "very" nice and immaculately clean. The bed was super comfortable and the bathroom was huge. Nice balcony too! Food was super. Definitely do all the specialty restaurents that you're entitled to. The menus were varied, service was good, and quality of the food was fantastic. The regular buffet was great too. Lots and lots of good choices from Island specialty dishes to standard American fare. The beach was just OK. Just sand and grasses on the bottom, but a small roped area. Pools were very nice. The staff kept everyone busy and entertained constantly. Night shows in the theater were enjoyable also. Would recommend this place to anyone.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.text: Our trip to the Iberostar Suites at Montego Bay was one of the best experiences of my life!!! From the time we walked off the bus until the time we stepped back on we had nothing but amazing service. 8:00 am every morning we always counted on Doreen(lobby bar) to start our day off with an amazing cappuccino or mimosa. She was ever so lovely to talk to. After 3:00 pm Ricardo(lobby bar) was the man to see. He made the best blue drink that tasted like kool-aid. He was awesome to talk to about the culture and to just share a laugh. The first day we went to the pool we met the entertainment staff. They are all so nice and loved to interact with people. Sasha was the first person we spoke to and right off the bat she remembered our names. From then on she was always calling us by name and inviting us to join in the games. Blanka and Monkey were also super awesome!! The shows were always great every night and I would suggest a nap before dinner so you make it to the show. House keeping kept up our rooms and turned down our beds everynight. The restaurants and bufffet had the best foods. The only thing I will complain about was the Japanese restaurant. The host was very rude and the women that cooked our food did not interact with our side of the table or even ask how we liked our food cooked. My boyfriend was also not feeling well that night and went back to the Suites after ordering dinner. They were very nice about it and stated they would take the plate to him. We gave them a tip to show our appreciation and then the food never showed. It may of been because we were from another hotel. I would give this hotel an A+ and we will be returning!!!
reviews.title: A-mazing!!!!

reviews.text: Our family stayed at the Iberostar mid June. The hotel facilities were nice, the staff was friendly and the food was good. The beach is not what I would consider your typical Carribean beach though. There was a lot of seaweed in the water and some areas of marsh bottoms. There were three rock structures off the beach which provide good snorkling. The snorkling trip that you pay for is worth the $39. The tell you to take bread and bannanas. The bread is for the fish, the bannanas are for the captain. The parasailing is fun as well with captain Ringo. He will give you your moneys worth. The food in the main buffet resturant is good and the wait staff cant do enough for you. Throw a few bucks their way. The appreciate that. The measure of a good vacation is whether you would go back or recommend to friends. I would not and only because of the beach and water. For the money there are a lot of other destinations which will give you cleaner beaches and clearer water
reviews.title: NICE PLACE BUT WOULDNT GO BACK

reviews.text: We just got back from this resort (June 3rd to 17th) I chose (as well as the destination) based on the several reviews here on TripAdvisor and thought that with more than 91% of customers happily satisfied, it was a safe choice.
reviews.title: Definitely recommended !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was indeed ! Everything that has been told is absolutely true ! If you're planning to book your tickets, go ahead ! Do not hesitate !
reviews.title: Very Pleased!

reviews.text: We just returned from a week stay at the Iberostar Rose Hall Suites. We were traveling with our 10 year old son and had a wonderful stay. As countless other reviews have already mentioned the resort and grounds are beautiful and extremely well kept. During our stay we did not have any negative experiences.
reviews.title: Fantastic resort!!! Great staff, great beach and great food

reviews.text: We ate at all the restaurants except the Mediterranean. We enjoyed all the meals that we had and found the service in the restaurants to be excellent. The Japanese restaurant was a blast. Contrary a recent review the staff do not bark at you and the food did not take forever. As for it being loud it is a Teppanyaki restaurant it is bound to be a little loud that is the nature of the beast. We were not able to secure a reservation to the Japanese restaurant upon our arrival. However I checked in with the Consierge frequently during our stay and she was able to book us in for dinner on our last night.
reviews.title: Jamaican paradise

reviews.text: Bring your own snorkel and mask! Find room in your bag it is well worth it. There are three artificial reefs along the beach the best is off of the Suites. I sent several hours swimming around this reef. I saw the following; King fish (poisonous so watch out) Sting ray, Barracuda, it was small and skittish, trumpet fish, squirrel fish and box fish. Before heading out grab a handful of the small dinner rolls from the buffet and take them with you. If you break them up the fish will swim right up to you and even eat out of your hand.
reviews.title: Best vacation ever! We can't wait to go back.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Here are some things we wish we knew earlier.
reviews.title: Better than I ever imagined

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bring white t-shirts. Once a week, Thursdays I believe, there is tie-dying by the pool. There is no charge all you need is a shirt.
reviews.title: Yeaaah Mon! Really great hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'm a very versatile traveler... I can shack up in crappy 3 stars in Cuba or go all the way like when I booked this one. Everything was perfect over there service at your beach chair, variety when it came to bottled beer and alcohol and food. I really can't point a downside to this place other than the beach is small but that's Jamaica for you! I recommend this place to anyone who's difficult I'm almost 100% certain that pretty much everybody will love this place... We went summer time so it was cheaper but I looked it up in march and the prices were a bit on the pricey side but again well worth it you only live once!
reviews.title: I'd say it's probably the best hotel i've stayed at

reviews.text: We had a wonderful stay at this resort.
reviews.title: Family Vacation

reviews.text: The staff was excellent, taking care of our every need.
reviews.title: Absolutely Fantastic!
Almost excellent
reviews.text: We had a guest that injured her ankle and I found the medical attention at the hotel very lacking, we were unable to get a simple ace bandage for her foot.
The rooms were good. We had an issue with our door not closing unless pulled very hard, and the celing fan made alot of noise, but these were minor problems overall the rooms and views were great.
reviews.title: Can't get enough!

reviews.text: My family and I traveled to the Iberostar Rose Hall suites to celebrate our 40th anniversary. We had 4 small children under the age of 5 with us.
reviews.title: Exceeded Our Expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location was beautifull. food and beverage was of high quality and plentifull.
reviews.title: Best place ever!

reviews.text: This is a European Hotel and reflects that style. The most distinct impression of the vacation was the care and gratutide the Jamaican Staff gace their guests. All of the staff make us feel wanted and welcome. The resort is clean and well maintained. We all enjoyed the pools and the sea. Sailing on the bay, or bbq on the beach.
reviews.title: Spotless, Entertaining, Full Service

reviews.text: DO NOT take the JTL excursion to the Luminous lagoon. The boat used was overloaded, unsafe , and totally 3rd world. Do not bother wandering off the property to visit the small craft village ajacent to the property. The evening shows were weak, but who can stay awake after being on the beach all day!
reviews.title: Lots to do in great place

reviews.text: Great Spa and Pools.
reviews.title: A Destination Wedding never to be forgotten!

reviews.text: My 3 year old son, myself and a friend spent 3 nights at Iberostar Rose Hall Suites at the beginning of June. This was the third and final resort in a 13 day trip. The two previous resorts were Sunset Beach Montego Bay and Franklyn D in Runaway Bay. All three resorts were completely different from each other, and I purposely put IBRHS at the end of the trip, both for purposes of geography and I knew it would be the nicest of the three in terms of room and grounds.
reviews.title: Very Long and Rambling Review

reviews.text: I booked the trip through Mark from TripGuy Travel. He was great to work with as the details of the trip kept changing. And by changing, I’m talking about not only the dates, but the resorts and who was staying with me at each of the resorts, culminating into me adding on a friend of mine who lives on the island 3 days before our arrival at Iberostar. He handled it all perfectly and with graciousness and I would recommend him to anyone and will definitely be using him again.
reviews.title: Exceeded expectations! Just plain fantastic!

reviews.text: My son and I arrived via private transport through Reggae Tours from FDR in Runaway Bay to Iberostar. Reggae Tours as usual was on time (early) and the driver was great. We arrived at the resort at around noon and were checked in quickly. I asked for a room with an awesome view and the gentleman who checked me in (I’m kicking myself I can’t remember his name!) said he would take care of me…and that he did. So much so after we got to our room I went right back down to the front desk and tipped him $10. Our room was on the side of the resort that is closest to the Beach resort. We were on the 3rd floor (which is actually the 4th floor), overlooking the pool and the ocean. Room 3327. Our room was two away from the Ocean Front Suites and because it was in the “orange” section that stuck out farther from the rest of the building we had a huge balcony. The room has a ton of shelf, drawer and hanging space and a large bathroom with separate tub and glassed in shower. Two double beds and a pull out bed in the couch. The pull out bed was really uncomfortable (duh…it’s a pull out bed) and I would not recommend it if you are planning on having a teenager or adult sleep on it. As mentioned our balcony was huge, although the majority of the rooms it is an average sized balcony. The view…..amazing. Everything in the room worked great (AC, Safe, etc) and with the exception of a sticky shower door was in tip top condition. This was the only resort where we had turn down service, and while not a necessity for me when choosing a resort, it was nice to have the room picked up and fresh towels when returning at night (the chocolate on the pillow wasn’t bad either!) Our mini bar was restocked each day at around 3:00 which happened to coincide with when my son was napping so I was there each day when they restocked. I asked him to skip everything but the Diet Coke and the Beer (Real Rock…not Red Stripe) and he happily obliged.
reviews.title: Overall best entertaining staff in Jamaica

reviews.text: After checking in we went to the buffet for lunch and it was still 30 minutes until it opened. This was one thing I didn’t like was how late lunch started at the buffet (1:00pm). You can go to the outdoor restaurant that doubles as the steak house at night, but it is outdoor dining, and at this point in my trip I was enjoying the novelty of the air conditioned dining option. We went to the lobby and had a drink and then headed back down to the buffet. AAAHHH Hello champagne for lunch! Neither of the other two resorts had champagne available so at this point my heart was won over. After a very nice buffet lunch we headed to the pool and spent the rest of the afternoon in the infinity pool. There was no problem getting a chair despite arriving this late in the day, although the fact that the resort was only at 50% occupancy helped. The pool area is clean and the view over the infinity area beautiful. The swim up bar is a nice place to hang out but the wait for drinks could get a little long during peak periods such as around 4:00 when people are coming off the beach for the day. This bar also serves as one of two walkup bars for the “beach people” which added to the wait times. When we were there they had a lot of bartenders at this bar with trainee badges which might account for the waits also.
reviews.title: Beautiful resort, beautiful wedding!

reviews.text: Restaurant Reservations. There is some confusion regarding the Suites and the # of ala carte restaurant reservations you can make. I’m not sure I can completely clear it up as I am still a bit confused but I will try. The pamphlet of information they give you when you check in states that they guarantee a certain number of restaurant reservations based on the number of nights you are staying, then it goes on to list a matrix of “X” number of nights to “X” number of nights is “X” number of reservations. I THINK they do this so that based on occupancy levels of the hotel they can limit the number of reservations people can make to ensure that if the hotel is near capacity everyone gets a chance to eat at some of the ala cartes. However, I THINK that if the capacity is lower they just let you make as many as you want. I was only staying 3 nights, and while the front desk person was checking to see if my room was ready I walked over to the desk where you do the reservations (If you are standing at the front desk look directly behind you and there it is) I told the very nice lady there that I was checking in for 3 nights and would like to make dinner reservations. She handed me the menus for all the restaurants at the Suites and then verbally told me about the ones at the Beach hotel. Traveling with a 3 year old I wanted an early reservation and had no problem getting 6:30 reservations for my first 3 choices. Since the restaurants are open on alternating nights it took a little juggling around. My suggestion is to let her know which restaurants you want to try during your stay and a range of times you want to eat at and let her figure out a date/restaurant schedule for you. I made reservations (in this order of my stay) for the Mexican, the Steakhouse and the Mediterranean. I would have loved to try the gourmet but had read reviews that this is the longest timewise of the dining experiences and didn’t want to subject my son to that (or the other diners to my son! HA HA).
reviews.title: Very impressed

aka: Iberostar Rose Hall Hotel Rose Hall
